channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: This untaxed vehicle/truck is abandoned at the entrance to Flint Down Close, 27th November
item.description:
This untaxed vehicle has been parked at the entrance of Flint Down Close for some months without moving. None of the immediate neighbours know who it belongs to. Our concern is because it is a narrow entrance to the close an emergency vehicle, such as a fire engine, or a big lorry delivery, would not be able to access the close or would cause damage to others properties. The truck needs to be removed rather than clamped. As an aside, one of the neighbours has a funeral next Tuesday (2 Dec) and they are concerned it may be a bit of a squeeze for the hearse to get through. I appreciate your attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Flint Down Close, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Please can the grass be cut at the rear of The Old Palace/Bromley Palace Park. It’s starting to get long in places. Thanks.

item.title: Very dangerous sharp steel where kids run& play, 27th November
item.description:
Location: St Mary Cray Recreation Ground, car park at end of Park Road. Knee barrier broken, 1no long steel pipe in the grass, 2no broken steel posts sticking out from the ground, with sharp edges! These look well corroded, surprised it's not been reported or fixed yet. Kids from nearby school are running and playing here, anyone can trip over, fall into it, very dangerous!! Please fix it urgently! Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Carnival Rubbish accumulated at footbridge near 41 Tavistock Crescent W11, 27th November
item.description:
Rubbish from two Notting Hill Carnivals (2024 and 2025) have accumulated ans has not been cleared. It is near housing and consists of bottles, cans, takeaway cartons and paper and plastic cups.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Tavistock Crescent, Kensal Town, Greater London

item.title: Assorted rubbish, dumped on the green intersection by Marble Arch Underground/Park Lane/Marble Arch, 26th November
item.description:
Many bags of rubbish, litter, stolen shopping trolleys- all abandoned there by the illegal vagrant encampment, set up by the organised illegal beggars (who quite likely do not have any legal right to be in the UK). This is part of the issue of the illegal encampment there. There is NO DRAINAGE. There will likely be human waste. There will likely be rats (pests). Huge public health risk. Right next to Marble Arch Underground station and Oxford St. Two of the busiest parts of the city. The scale/size of the dumped rubbish has DOUBLED in the last 48 hours. I predicted and warned that the problem would get worse-and it has. Reported this issue, over and over. Westminster Police: do nothing. TfL: the landlord of this plot-do nothing. Mayor (also Chair of TfL): does nothing. GLA: no action UK Home Office-Immigration Enforcement: do nothing. (Along with the rest of central govt.) Westminster City Council: v v slow to act. Hopefully they will do something.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Lane, Marylebone, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
